meanings.definition: The relationship between a client and a professional service provider.
meanings.sent1: The clientages of the lawyer and her clients was built on trust.
meanings.sent2: The company's success depended on maintaining a loyal clientages.
meanings.sent3: The clientages of the hairdresser and her customers was a cut above the rest.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, clientages are like precious gems waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The clientages of the doctor were so satisfied that they referred all their friends.

meanings.definition: The group of clients or customers served by a business.
meanings.sent1: The hotel's clientages included tourists from all over the world.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant's clientages varied from locals to travelers passing through.
meanings.sent3: The clientages of the bookstore were always eager for the latest bestsellers.
meanings.sent4: The clientages of the gym were a diverse mix of fitness enthusiasts.
meanings.sent5: The clientages of the cafe enjoyed their daily dose of caffeine with a smile.

meanings.definition: The practice of being a client or customer.
meanings.sent1: Her clientages at the beauty salon always left feeling pampered.
meanings.sent2: The clientages of the online store enjoyed the convenience of shopping from home.
meanings.sent3: Joining the clientages of the exclusive club meant access to VIP events.
meanings.sent4: The clientages of the car dealership were treated to special discounts.
meanings.sent5: Being part of the clientages of the spa meant indulging in luxurious treatments.
